page.title: 09Playground Games, Montrose.
page.content: In the playground of{Borrowfield {Primary School Montrose,}most of the well known games such as{"Tig"}and {"Chain Tig"}are still popular with boys and girls.{Football}remains a favourite with the boys and girls can often be seen with{skipping}ropes and playing{"Doublers"}with tennis balls against the school wall.{"Manhunt"}is a variation of "Tig" where someone is a catcher. He has to count to fifty while the rest run away. When he catches someone, that person also becomes a catcher. The last person caught is the winner.The first one caught is tha catcher in the next game.{"T.V.Programmes"}is a game where one player thinks of a T.V. programme then gives the first letter of each word. The others have to guess what the programme is. The person to guess correctly is the winner.
